channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE

item.title: NEW: Azure Down: Misconfiguration Triggers Global Microsoft Service Outage
item.description:
Headline: Azure Down: Misconfiguration Triggers Global Microsoft Service Outage

Summary:
A faulty configuration change in Microsoft's Azure Front Door (AFD) service on October 29-30, 2025, led to a multi-hour global outage. The incident caused widespread latency, timeouts, and connection failures for numerous Microsoft services, including Microsoft 365, Xbox Live, and Entra ID, as well as customer applications like Alaska Airlines' website. Microsoft engineers identified the inadvertent tenant configuration change as the root cause and initiated a rollback to restore services. The event highlights the systemic risk and fragility within globally interconnected cloud ecosystems, where a single non-malicious error can have a cascading, worldwide impact.

Severity: High

Categories: Cloud Security, Cyberattack, Incident Response

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Microsoft Azure outage, Azure Front Door, cloud outage, Microsoft 365 down, global outage, configuration error, Alaska Airlines, cloud security, incident response

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A major Microsoft Azure outage on Oct 29-30, 2025, caused by a configuration error in Azure Front Door, disrupted global services like Microsoft 365 and Xbox Live.

Article Slug: microsoft-azure-outage-disrupts-global-services-after-configuration-error

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Conduent Data Breach: 10 Million+ Individuals' Personal & Medical Data Exposed
item.description:
Headline: Conduent Data Breach: 10 Million+ Individuals' Personal & Medical Data Exposed

Summary:
Conduent Business Services, a major contractor for U.S. government agencies, has disclosed a massive data breach impacting over 10 million individuals. The incident, which occurred between October 2024 and January 2025, involved an unauthorized third party gaining access to Conduent's network and exfiltrating files. The compromised data is highly sensitive, including names, Social Security numbers, medical information, and health insurance details. The breach has affected residents across numerous states, including Texas, Washington, and California, and has triggered a legal investigation by the law firm Edelson Lechtzin LLP into the company's data privacy practices.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Conduent data breach, government contractor breach, PII leak, PHI breach, Edelson Lechtzin LLP, identity theft, cybersecurity incident, data privacy

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Government contractor Conduent confirms a data breach exposed the personal and medical information, including Social Security numbers, of over 10 million individuals.

Article Slug: government-contractor-conduent-breach-exposes-data-of-10-million

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Scattered Spider's Phishing Blitz Caused Millions in Damages to UK Retailers
item.description:
Headline: Scattered Spider's Phishing Blitz Caused Millions in Damages to UK Retailers

Summary:
A new phishing report from KnowBe4 has attributed hundreds of millions in damages at major UK retailers like M&S, Co-Op, and Harrods to the cybercrime group 'Scattered Spider'. The group utilizes a potent mix of social engineering, vishing (voice phishing), and MFA bombing to circumvent security controls. After breaching the companies, Scattered Spider launched secondary phishing campaigns impersonating the brands to steal customer credentials. The report also highlights a massive 449% increase in vishing attacks in 2025 and the growing use of AI-generated voices in callback scams, signaling a shift towards human-layer attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Scattered Spider, phishing report, vishing, MFA bombing, MFA fatigue, KnowBe4, UK retail breach, social engineering, cybercrime

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A KnowBe4 report reveals the 'Scattered Spider' cybercrime group caused millions in damages to UK retailers using advanced vishing, social engineering, and MFA bombing tactics.

Article Slug: scattered-spider-linked-to-major-uk-retail-breaches-in-phishing-report

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New 'Herodotus' Android Trojan Mimics Human Typing to Defeat Biometric Security
item.description:
Headline: New 'Herodotus' Android Trojan Mimics Human Typing to Defeat Biometric Security

Summary:
A new Android banking trojan, named 'Herodotus,' is being sold as a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) and is designed to evade modern behavioral biometric security. According to researchers at Threat Fabric, the malware gains full control of a device via Accessibility Service abuse. Its key innovation is the ability to 'humanize' fraudulent actions by simulating realistic typing, introducing random delays between keystrokes. This allows it to perform automated on-device fraud, such as transferring funds, while appearing as a legitimate user. The malware, spread via smishing, has been observed targeting banking users in Italy and Brazil.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Mobile Security, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Herodotus malware, Android banking trojan, Threat Fabric, MaaS, smishing, on-device fraud, behavioral biometrics, Accessibility Service abuse

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers have discovered 'Herodotus,' a new Android banking trojan that mimics human typing with random delays to bypass behavioral biometric fraud detection systems.

Article Slug: herodotus-android-malware-mimics-human-typing-to-bypass-security

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ad Giant Dentsu's Subsidiary Merkle Hit by Cyberattack, Staff and Client Data Exposed
item.description:
Headline: Ad Giant Dentsu's Subsidiary Merkle Hit by Cyberattack, Staff and Client Data Exposed

Summary:
Global advertising firm Dentsu has confirmed that its US-based customer experience management (CXM) subsidiary, Merkle, was the target of a cyberattack. The company detected 'abnormal activity' on Merkle's network and proactively shut down certain systems to contain the threat. An investigation has confirmed that the incident led to the exposure of both staff and sensitive client data. Merkle, a major player in the CXM industry, handles large volumes of customer data, making it a high-value target for threat actors. The full scope of the breach is still under investigation.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Dentsu cyberattack, Merkle data breach, customer experience management, CXM security, advertising agency breach, supply chain attack, client data exposed

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Global advertising firm Dentsu confirmed its US subsidiary, Merkle, was hit by a cyberattack that exposed both staff and sensitive client data, prompting system shutdowns.

Article Slug: dentsu-subsidiary-merkle-hit-by-cyberattack-exposing-data

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: EY Leaks 4TB+ SQL Database Packed with Corporate Secrets via Cloud Misconfiguration
item.description:
Headline: EY Leaks 4TB+ SQL Database Packed with Corporate Secrets via Cloud Misconfiguration

Summary:
Consulting giant EY (Ernst & Young) inadvertently exposed a massive, 4TB+ SQL Server backup file to the public internet due to a cloud storage misconfiguration. The unencrypted `.BAK` file, discovered by researchers at Neo Security, contained a treasure trove of highly sensitive internal data, including API keys, service account passwords, session tokens, and user credentials. The incident highlights the severe risks associated with cloud service misconfigurations, where tools designed for convenience can lead to catastrophic data exposure if not secured properly. Neo Security described the leak as equivalent to finding the 'master blueprint and physical keys to a vault.'

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Vulnerability

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: EY data leak, Ernst & Young breach, cloud misconfiguration, SQL database exposed, Neo Security, cloud security posture management, CSPM, data exposure

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Consulting firm EY exposed a 4TB+ unencrypted SQL Server backup file containing API keys, passwords, and other sensitive data on the public internet due to a cloud misconfiguration.

Article Slug: consulting-giant-ey-exposes-4tb-sql-database-to-internet

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: IncRansom Claims 20TB Data Heist from Evolve Mortgage Services
item.description:
Headline: IncRansom Claims 20TB Data Heist from Evolve Mortgage Services

Summary:
The 'incransom' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a significant data breach at Evolve Mortgage Services, listing the company on its dark web leak site on October 30, 2025. The attackers allege they have stolen over 20 terabytes of data, including 2 terabytes of databases containing sensitive PII such as Social Security numbers, client IDs, and full credit histories dating back to 2016. The group is using a pure data-theft extortion model, threatening to leak the data after claiming the company refused to negotiate. This incident highlights the ongoing threat of data extortion attacks against the U.S. financial services sector.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: incransom, Evolve Mortgage Services, ransomware, data theft, dark web leak, financial services breach, data extortion

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The incransom ransomware group has claimed a major data breach at Evolve Mortgage Services, alleging the theft of over 20TB of data including SSNs and credit histories.

Article Slug: incransom-gang-claims-20tb-data-theft-from-evolve-mortgage-services

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK Proposes Ransomware Payment Ban as 'Nationally Significant' Cyberattacks Double
item.description:
Headline: UK Proposes Ransomware Payment Ban as 'Nationally Significant' Cyberattacks Double

Summary:
The UK is facing an 'alarming' increase in cyber threats, with a GCHQ report revealing that 'nationally significant' cyberattacks more than doubled to 204 in the past year, costing the economy billions. High-profile ransomware attacks on companies like Marks & Spencer and Jaguar Land Rover have inflicted massive financial damage. In response, the UK government is consulting on new legislation that includes a targeted ban on ransomware payments for public sector bodies and critical national infrastructure operators. The proposals aim to disrupt the ransomware business model and improve national threat intelligence through mandated incident reporting.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Ransomware

Article Type: Advisory

Keywords: UK ransomware ban, NCSC annual review, GCHQ report, cybersecurity legislation UK, ransomware payment, critical national infrastructure, Cybersecurity and Resilience Bill

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: In response to a GCHQ report showing UK cyberattacks have doubled, the government is consulting on new laws, including a targeted ban on ransomware payments for critical infrastructure.

Article Slug: uk-sees-alarming-rise-in-cyber-threats-proposes-ransomware-payment-ban

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA: Patch Now! Critical, Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in Windows Server (WSUS)
item.description:
Headline: CISA: Patch Now! Critical, Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in Windows Server (WSUS)

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued an urgent alert for a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287, in Microsoft's Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). The flaw is being actively exploited in the wild, allowing unauthenticated attackers to gain system-level privileges on vulnerable servers. A previous patch was incomplete, necessitating an out-of-band security update from Microsoft. CISA has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog and is instructing organizations to apply the new patch immediately or take mitigation steps.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Keywords: CVE-2025-59287, CISA KEV, WSUS vulnerability, Windows Server exploit, remote code execution, Huntress, patch management, CISA alert

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: CISA issues an urgent alert for CVE-2025-59287, a critical, actively exploited RCE vulnerability in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), and urges immediate patching.

Article Slug: cisa-warns-of-active-exploitation-of-critical-wsus-vulnerability-cve-2025-59287

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New 'logins[.]zip' Infostealer Claims 99% Credential Theft in 12 Seconds Using Zero-Days
item.description:
Headline: New 'logins[.]zip' Infostealer Claims 99% Credential Theft in 12 Seconds Using Zero-Days

Summary:
A new Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) infostealer named 'logins[.]zip' is being sold on the clear web, boasting incredible speed and efficiency. According to a report from Hudson Rock, its authors claim it can exfiltrate 99% of passwords and cookies from a victim's machine in under 12 seconds. The stealer's key selling point is its alleged use of two Chromium zero-day exploits, which allow it to steal credentials without needing admin rights. The service, sold for $150/month, provides a browser-based builder for creating polymorphic stubs and targets logins, cookies, payment cards, and crypto wallets.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: logins.zip malware, infostealer MaaS, Chromium zero day, Hudson Rock, credential theft, Lumma stealer, RedLine stealer, malware as a service

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new Malware-as-a-Service infostealer called 'logins[.]zip' is being sold on the clear web, claiming to use Chromium zero-days to steal 99% of credentials in under 12 seconds.

Article Slug: new-logins-zip-infostealer-service-uses-browser-exploits-for-rapid-theft

Published Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: UK's NCSC Warns 'Nationally Significant' Cyber Attacks Have More Than Doubled
item.description:
Headline: UK's NCSC Warns 'Nationally Significant' Cyber Attacks Have More Than Doubled

Summary:
The UK's National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) has released its 2025 Annual Review, revealing a stark increase in major cyber threats. The agency handled 204 'nationally significant' incidents in the past year, more than double the 89 from the previous year. Ransomware remains the most acute threat, particularly to the UK's Critical National Infrastructure (CNI). The report highlights a growing gap between the escalating threats from APTs and cybercriminals and the nation's collective defenses, prompting the NCSC to urge all UK businesses to make cyber resilience a board-level priority and adopt foundational security controls.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Ransomware

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre's (NCSC) 2025 annual review shows that nationally significant cyber attacks more than doubled to 204 in the past year, with ransomware being the top threat.

Article Slug: uk-ncsc-reports-nationally-significant-cyber-attacks-doubled

Published Date: Wed, 15 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 15 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 30 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Urgent Patch Mandated for Actively Exploited Windows WSUS RCE Flaw
item.description:
Headline: Urgent Patch Mandated for Actively Exploited Windows WSUS RCE Flaw

Summary:
A critical, wormable remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287, in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) is being actively exploited in the wild. The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the flaw to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog and issued a binding directive ordering federal agencies to apply an emergency out-of-band patch from Microsoft by November 14, 2025. The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to achieve SYSTEM-level privileges. A threat actor tracked as UNC6512 has been linked to attacks leveraging this flaw, escalating the urgency for all organizations to patch immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: CISA mandates urgent patching for the actively exploited, critical RCE vulnerability CVE-2025-59287 in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), which could lead to network-wide compromise.

Article Slug: cisa-mandates-urgent-patch-for-actively-exploited-windows-wsus-flaw

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: FIN11 & Clop Ransomware Hit Industrial Giants with Oracle EBS Zero-Day
item.description:
Headline: FIN11 & Clop Ransomware Hit Industrial Giants with Oracle EBS Zero-Day

Summary:
Industrial giants Schneider Electric and Emerson are among the latest high-profile victims of zero-day attacks targeting Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) applications. The financially motivated threat group FIN11, known for its affiliation with Clop ransomware, is the suspected perpetrator. The Clop leak site claims to have exfiltrated terabytes of sensitive data from the victims, signaling a severe supply chain and critical infrastructure threat that traditional security tools failed to detect.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Suspected FIN11 and Clop ransomware actors exploit an Oracle E-Business Suite zero-day to attack industrial giants Emerson and Schneider Electric, exfiltrating terabytes of data.

Article Slug: fin11-clop-ransomware-linked-to-oracle-ebs-zero-day-attacks

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: CISA KEV Alert: Active Exploits Target Dassault DELMIA Apriso Manufacturing Software
item.description:
Headline: CISA KEV Alert: Active Exploits Target Dassault DELMIA Apriso Manufacturing Software

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added two critical vulnerabilities affecting Dassault Systèmes' DELMIA Apriso manufacturing software to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaws, a code injection (CVE-2025-6204) and a missing authorization bug (CVE-2025-6205), are confirmed to be under active exploitation. This poses a severe risk to global manufacturing operations, potentially leading to operational shutdowns and intellectual property theft.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Industrial Control Systems, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: CISA warns of active exploitation of two critical vulnerabilities, CVE-2025-6204 and CVE-2025-6205, in Dassault Systèmes' DELMIA Apriso manufacturing software.

Article Slug: cisa-adds-actively-exploited-dassault-systemes-flaws-to-kev-catalog

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: "Shadow Escape": New Zero-Click Attack Steals Data from ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini
item.description:
Headline: "Shadow Escape": New Zero-Click Attack Steals Data from ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini

Summary:
A novel zero-click attack vector named "Shadow Escape" has been discovered by researchers at Operant, capable of silently exfiltrating sensitive data from popular AI agents like OpenAI's ChatGPT, Anthropic's Claude, and Google's Gemini. The attack exploits the Model Context Protocol (MCP) by embedding hidden malicious instructions within seemingly benign documents. This allows for the theft of personally identifiable information (PII) without any user interaction, bypassing traditional security tools and posing a significant threat to enterprises adopting agentic AI.

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers uncover "Shadow Escape," a zero-click attack that exploits the Model Context Protocol (MCP) in AI agents like ChatGPT and Gemini to silently steal sensitive data.

Article Slug: shadow-escape-zero-click-attack-steals-data-from-ai-agents

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive 70TB Data Leak at Tata Motors from Exposed AWS Keys
item.description:
Headline: Massive 70TB Data Leak at Tata Motors from Exposed AWS Keys

Summary:
A colossal security failure at Tata Motors has resulted in the exposure of over 70 terabytes of sensitive corporate data, customer information, and infrastructure details. The breach, which was first identified in 2023, stemmed from multiple critical misconfigurations, including plaintext Amazon Web Services (AWS) access keys hardcoded on a customer-facing website. These credentials provided unrestricted access to numerous S3 buckets containing a vast trove of data, including customer PII and financial records.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security, Policy and Compliance

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Over 70TB of sensitive data from Tata Motors was exposed due to misconfigured AWS access keys left in plaintext on a public website, leading to a major data breach.

Article Slug: tata-motors-exposes-70tb-of-data-via-misconfigured-aws-keys

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: BlueNoroff APT Targets macOS Users with "GhostCall" & "GhostHire" Campaigns
item.description:
Headline: BlueNoroff APT Targets macOS Users with "GhostCall" & "GhostHire" Campaigns

Summary:
Researchers at Kaspersky have detailed two sophisticated, ongoing campaigns by the BlueNoroff advanced persistent threat (APT) group, dubbed "GhostCall" and "GhostHire." Active since at least April 2025, these operations specifically target macOS users with a complex arsenal of malware. The campaigns leverage at least seven distinct multi-stage execution chains, deploying information stealers and keyloggers through social engineering lures like fake Zoom clients and ChatGPT-enhanced images.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The BlueNoroff APT group is targeting macOS users with sophisticated "GhostCall" and "GhostHire" campaigns, using multi-stage malware and social engineering to steal information.

Article Slug: bluenoroff-apt-targets-macos-with-ghostcall-and-ghosthire-campaigns

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New "Airstalk" Malware Abuses VMware API in Nation-State Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
Headline: New "Airstalk" Malware Abuses VMware API in Nation-State Supply Chain Attack

Summary:
A newly identified malware strain, "Airstalk," has been deployed in a sophisticated supply chain attack believed to be sponsored by a nation-state actor. The activity, tracked as the cluster CL-STA-1009, is notable for its novel command-and-control (C2) technique: it misuses the API of VMware's Workspace ONE Unified Endpoint Management (UEM), formerly AirWatch, to communicate covertly. The malware is also signed with a likely stolen digital certificate to evade detection, pointing to a well-resourced and stealthy adversary.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A new malware strain named "Airstalk" is being used in a nation-state supply chain attack, using the VMware Workspace ONE API for command and control.

Article Slug: airstalk-malware-used-in-suspected-nation-state-supply-chain-attack

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Herodotus Android Malware Mimics Human Typing to Bypass Biometric Security
item.description:
Headline: Herodotus Android Malware Mimics Human Typing to Bypass Biometric Security

Summary:
A new Android banking trojan named Herodotus has emerged, offered as a Malware-as-a-Service (MaaS) by a threat actor known as 'K1R0'. The malware is notable for its novel evasion technique: it mimics human typing behavior by introducing random delays during remote control sessions. This method is specifically designed to defeat behavioral biometric security systems that analyze user interaction patterns to detect fraud. Active campaigns have been observed targeting banking and crypto app users in Italy and Brazil.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Mobile Security, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The Herodotus Android banking trojan, a new MaaS offering, evades behavioral biometric detection by mimicking human typing patterns to conduct fraudulent transactions.

Article Slug: herodotus-android-malware-mimics-human-typing-to-evade-detection

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Chrome Zero-Day Exploited by "Mem3nt0 mori" APT to Deploy Spyware
item.description:
Headline: Chrome Zero-Day Exploited by "Mem3nt0 mori" APT to Deploy Spyware

Summary:
A critical zero-day vulnerability in Google Chrome, CVE-2025-2783, has been actively exploited in a targeted espionage campaign dubbed "Operation ForumTroll." The campaign, which began in March 2025, is attributed to the advanced persistent threat (APT) group known as "Mem3nt0 mori." The attackers used the exploit to deliver a sophisticated backdoor called LeetAgent, a spyware tool developed by the Italian vendor Memento Labs, primarily targeting organizations in Russia and Belarus.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Mem3nt0 mori APT group exploited a Chrome zero-day, CVE-2025-2783, to deliver LeetAgent spyware in a targeted espionage campaign against Russian and Belarusian organizations.

Article Slug: chrome-zero-day-exploited-in-espionage-campaign-by-mem3nt0-mori

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: "Scattered Spider" Tactics Drive Surge in Vishing and Massive Retail Breaches
item.description:
Headline: "Scattered Spider" Tactics Drive Surge in Vishing and Massive Retail Breaches

Summary:
A new report from KnowBe4 highlights the devastating impact of the "Scattered Spider" (UNC3944) cybercrime group and a dramatic rise in voice phishing (vishing) as defining threats of 2025. The group successfully breached high-profile UK retailers, including M&S and Harrods, causing damages in the hundreds of millions of pounds. Their tactics, which blend social engineering, MFA bombing, and deepfake audio, have created a blueprint for modern cybercrime. The report also notes a 449% increase in phone-based vishing attacks, often leveraging AI-generated voices.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Data Breach

Article Type: Report

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A KnowBe4 report links the Scattered Spider cybercrime group to major retail breaches and highlights a 449% surge in vishing attacks as a key threat trend in 2025.

Article Slug: scattered-spider-tactics-drive-surge-in-vishing-and-retail-breaches

Published Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 29 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Qantas Data Breach: 5.7M Customer Records Leaked in Salesforce Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
Headline: Qantas Data Breach: 5.7M Customer Records Leaked in Salesforce Supply Chain Attack

Summary:
The personal data of 5.7 million Qantas Airways customers has been published on the dark web by a group calling itself 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters'. The leak, which occurred after a ransom deadline passed on October 11, 2025, is part of a broader supply chain attack that compromised a third-party Salesforce system used by one of the airline's offshore call centers. The compromised data includes names, emails, frequent flyer information, and for some, addresses, phone numbers, and dates of birth. The attack vector involved social engineering, with hackers impersonating Salesforce employees to gain access. Qantas confirmed the breach, stating it is one of 39 companies affected by the campaign and that financial data and passwords were not compromised. The incident has prompted warnings of secondary phishing attacks and a class-action complaint.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

Article Type: NewsArticle

item.title: UPDATE: Clop Ransomware Breaches American Airlines Subsidiary Envoy Air, Exploiting Oracle EBS Flaw
item.description:
Headline: Clop Ransomware Breaches American Airlines Subsidiary Envoy Air, Exploiting Oracle EBS Flaw

Summary:
Envoy Air, a regional airline owned by American Airlines, has confirmed it was a victim of a hacking campaign orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The attackers exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite (EBS) to gain access and exfiltrate data. While Envoy Air states that no sensitive customer or personal data was compromised, the breach involved some business information and commercial contacts. Clop has listed American Airlines among more than 60 victims of its recent campaign targeting unpatched Oracle systems, threatening to leak stolen data if ransoms are not paid.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Vulnerability

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Clop ransomware, Envoy Air breach, American Airlines hack, Oracle E-Business Suite vulnerability, CVE-2023-21931, aviation cybersecurity, data extortion, Clop leak site

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Clop ransomware group has breached Envoy Air, a subsidiary of American Airlines, by exploiting vulnerabilities in Oracle E-Business Suite, resulting in a data breach.

Article Slug: clop-ransomware-breaches-american-airlines-subsidiary-via-oracle-ebs-flaw
